title: How to Make a Shrimp out of a Plastic Straw

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/11\/IMG_0342_24.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/11\/IMG_0342_24.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":424,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":700.5442176870748,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Cut along the length of the straw until you get to the bendy part. It can help to draw the line first before cutting it to make sure it's straight.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f2\/IMG_0343_472.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f2\/IMG_0343_472.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":428,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":706.8,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/02\/IMG_0344_390.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/02\/IMG_0344_390.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":442,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":730.354609929078,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Make two additional cuts, splitting the straw into three pieces. The easiest way to do this is to make two little cuts at the bottom, then complete them by cutting all the way to the bendy part. One of the pieces should be skinnier than the other two.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7c\/IMG_0345_33.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7c\/IMG_0345_33.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":430,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":709.6864111498257,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Fold the skinniest piece in half, lengthwise.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f5\/IMG_0315_544.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f5\/IMG_0315_544.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":423,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":699.2,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Wrap one of the other pieces under the folded piece.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/IMG_0316_361.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/IMG_0316_361.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":365,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":602.9333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Pull it around and over the folded piece, then through the loop it made in the previous step.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/76\/IMG_0318_721.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/76\/IMG_0318_721.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":414,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":684.6846846846847,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Pull tight.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/33\/IMG_0320_905.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/33\/IMG_0320_905.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":412,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":680.7194244604317,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7d/IMG_0321_464.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7d/IMG_0321_464.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":330,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":544.6666666666666,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ed/IMG_0322_321.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ed/IMG_0322_321.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":368,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":608,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/IMG_0323_121.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/IMG_0323_121.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":390,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":644.8484848484849,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Turn it around and do the same with the other piece.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/91\/IMG_0324_436.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/91\/IMG_0324_436.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":377,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":623.2,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Turn back to the other side piece and pull it so that it's parallel to the folded piece.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/28\/IMG_0346_480.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/28\/IMG_0346_480.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":417,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":689.0666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Crease it at the base so it stays put.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d6\/IMG_0327_172.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d6\/IMG_0327_172.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":331,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":547.2,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Pull it under, around and through like you did the other knots.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d7\/IMG_0329_550.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d7\/IMG_0329_550.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":446,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":737.2,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Pull it tight.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/37\/IMG_0330_912.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/37\/IMG_0330_912.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":417,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":689.0666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/28/IMG_0331_321.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/28/IMG_0331_321.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":412,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":681.4666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/ae/IMG_0332_150.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/ae/IMG_0332_150.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":415,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":685.2991452991453,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d7/IMG_0333_131.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d7/IMG_0333_131.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":431,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":712,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/IMG_0334_750.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/IMG_0334_750.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":350,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":577.6,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Turn it around and do the same to the other side (crease, pull under, around and through, pull tight). It should look like this on the top. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0a/IMG_0335_998.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0a/IMG_0335_998.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":399,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":659.040590405904,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} It should look like this on the side. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/cc/IMG_0336_581.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/cc/IMG_0336_581.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":420,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":694.1333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2c\/IMG_0338_108.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2c\/IMG_0338_108.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":389,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":643.4666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description:
Keep going until you don't have enough of either piece to knot any more. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d1\/IMG_0339_457.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d1\/IMG_0339_457.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":424,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":701.0612244897959,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} It should look like this now.

steps.headline: Pull one of the side pieces up and crease the fold at the base.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fe\/IMG_0349_873.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fe\/IMG_0349_873.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":363,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":600.4,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Fold it in half and crease it at the fold.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3c\/IMG_0350_710.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3c\/IMG_0350_710.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":368,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":608,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Cut it to make legs. Repeat with the other side piece. You'll have to fiddle with them some so that they look right and so that it can stand up.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b5\/IMG_0351_428.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b5\/IMG_0351_428.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":402,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":663.7333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Trim the folded piece (the one that had the other two pieces wrapped around it) to the length you want your shrimp's antennae.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/ba\/IMG_0352_6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/ba\/IMG_0352_6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":454,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":749.8666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Cut the piece in half lengthwise.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/60\/IMG_0354_992.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/60\/IMG_0354_992.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":416,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":686.5333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Trim them to half their length, then trim the bottom ones additionally.

steps.headline: Curl the antennae with your nail.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/43\/IMG_0356_267.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/43\/IMG_0356_267.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":457,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":754.9333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Flatten the tail past the bendy part so you can cut more easily.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0d\/IMG_0357_174.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0d\/IMG_0357_174.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":419,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":691.6,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Trim the tail in a rounded cut.

steps.headline: Slit the sides of the tail and then bend it in a shrimpy shape (see the video below).

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/14\/IMG_0359_554.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/14\/IMG_0359_554.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":317,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":524.4,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Admire your straw shrimp!

sentences:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/11\/IMG_0342_24.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/11\/IMG_0342_24.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":424,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":700.5442176870748,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Cut along the length of the straw until you get to the bendy part.
It can help to draw the line first before cutting it to make sure it's straight.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f2/IMG_0343_472.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f2/IMG_0343_472.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":428,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":706.8,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/02/IMG_0344_390.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/02/IMG_0344_390.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":442,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":730.354609929078,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Make two additional cuts, splitting the straw into three pieces.
The easiest way to do this is to make two little cuts at the bottom, then complete them by cutting all the way to the bendy part.
One of the pieces should be skinnier than the other two.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7c\/IMG_0345_33.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7c\/IMG_0345_33.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":430,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":709.6864111498257,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Fold the skinniest piece in half, lengthwise.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f5\/IMG_0315_544.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f5\/IMG_0315_544.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":423,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":699.2,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Wrap one of the other pieces under the folded piece.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/IMG_0316_361.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/IMG_0316_361.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":365,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":602.9333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pull it around and over the folded piece, then through the loop it made in the previous step.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/76\/IMG_0318_721.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/76\/IMG_0318_721.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":414,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":684.6846846846847,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pull tight.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/33/IMG_0320_905.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/33/IMG_0320_905.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":412,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":680.7194244604317,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7d/IMG_0321_464.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7d/IMG_0321_464.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":330,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":544.6666666666666,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ed/IMG_0322_321.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ed/IMG_0322_321.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":368,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":608,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/IMG_0323_121.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/IMG_0323_121.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":390,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":644.8484848484849,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Turn it around and do the same with the other piece.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/91\/IMG_0324_436.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/91\/IMG_0324_436.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":377,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":623.2,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Turn back to the other side piece and pull it so that it's parallel to the folded piece.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/28\/IMG_0346_480.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/28\/IMG_0346_480.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":417,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":689.0666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Crease it at the base so it stays put.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d6\/IMG_0327_172.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d6\/IMG_0327_172.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":331,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":547.2,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pull it under, around and through like you did the other knots.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d7\/IMG_0329_550.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d7\/IMG_0329_550.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":446,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":737.2,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pull it tight.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/37/IMG_0330_912.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/37/IMG_0330_912.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":417,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":689.0666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/28/IMG_0331_321.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/28/IMG_0331_321.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":412,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":681.4666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/ae/IMG_0332_150.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/ae/IMG_0332_150.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":415,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":685.2991452991453,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d7/IMG_0333_131.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d7/IMG_0333_131.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":431,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":712,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/IMG_0334_750.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/IMG_0334_750.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":350,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":577.6,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Turn it around and do the same to the other side (crease, pull under, around and through, pull tight).
It should look like this on the top.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0a\/IMG_0335_998.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0a\/IMG_0335_998.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":399,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":659.040590405904,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} It should look like this on the side.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/cc/IMG_0336_581.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/cc/IMG_0336_581.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":420,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":694.1333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/2c/IMG_0338_108.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/2c/IMG_0338_108.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":389,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":643.4666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Keep going until you don't have enough of either piece to knot any more.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d1\/IMG_0339_457.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d1\/IMG_0339_457.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":424,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":701.0612244897959,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} It should look like this now.
Pull one of the side pieces up and crease the fold at the base.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fe\/IMG_0349_873.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fe\/IMG_0349_873.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":363,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":600.4,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Fold it in half and crease it at the fold.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3c\/IMG_0350_710.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3c\/IMG_0350_710.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":368,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":608,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Cut it to make legs.
Repeat with the other side piece.
You'll have to fiddle with them some so that they look right and so that it can stand up.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b5\/IMG_0351_428.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b5\/IMG_0351_428.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":402,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":663.7333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Trim the folded piece (the one that had the other two pieces wrapped around it) to the length you want your shrimp's antennae.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/ba\/IMG_0352_6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/ba\/IMG_0352_6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":454,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":749.8666666666667,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Cut the piece in half lengthwise.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/60\/IMG_0354_992.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/60\/IMG_0354_992.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":416,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":686.5333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Trim them to half their length, then trim the bottom ones additionally.
Curl the antennae with your nail.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/43\/IMG_0356_267.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/43\/IMG_0356_267.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":457,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":754.9333333333333,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Flatten the tail past the bendy part so you can cut more easily.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0d\/IMG_0357_174.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0d\/IMG_0357_174.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":419,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":691.6,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Trim the tail in a rounded cut.
Slit the sides of the tail and then bend it in a shrimpy shape (see the video below).

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/14\/IMG_0359_554.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/14\/IMG_0359_554.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":317,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":524.4,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Admire your straw shrimp!
